questiondata.text:
What does the RMS value of a cyclically varying current mean?

i1

MCSR.choiceA: It is the equivalent steady AC current

MCSR.choiceB: It is the equivalent steady DC current

MCSR.choiceC: It is just another term for cyclically varying current

questiondata.text:
In order to do work, energy is?

i1

learning-objectives: Gain adequate knowledge of the fundamentals of dynamic motion and mechanical and electrical properties/To understand the concept of power and energy in electrical theory

questiondata.text:
Power is defined as

i1

MCSR.choiceA: P = W/t, where W is work and t is time

MCSR.choiceB: P = t/W, where t is time and W is work

MCSR.choiceC: P = W/d, where W is work and d is distance

MCSR.choiceD: P = d/W, where d is distance and W is work

learning-objectives: Gain adequate knowledge of the fundamentals of dynamic motion and mechanical and electrical properties/To understand the concept of power and energy in electrical theory

questiondata.text: A small printer uses a rotating head to impress a mark on a continuously moving film. The circumference of the head is much less than the interval between impressions, so the head stops between impressions. It accelerates until the speed of the circumference is synchronised with the speed of the film, holds that speed while the impression is made, then comes to a halt again. The resulting requirement is that the print head performs one revolution in 0.05 sec, then waits for 0.01 sec before repeating the operation. Use the Profile widget to create a symmetrical profile.i1i2i3i4

instructions.html: Enter the correct values in input fields. Click Submit to check your answers.

questiondata.text: A small printer head performs one revolution in 0.05 sec, then waits for 0.01 sec before repeating the operation. The rotational velocity when synchronised is 1500 rpm. The inertia of the print head is 0.0001 kg-m2, and friction can be considered negligible. There is no externally applied torque. Calculate Peak Torque and RMS Torque using the following data table.i1
